content.text:
# King Shenjing of Zhou

|p2=Zhōu Shènjìng Wáng |w2=Chou Shènchìng-wangKing Shènchìng of Chou |l2=The Cautious and Beautiful King of Zhou
}}
King Shenjing of Zhou (), personal name Ji Ding, was the penultimate king of China's Zhou dynasty.
He was a son of his predecessor, King Xian, and thus nephew of King Lie; his paternal grandfather was King An. He reigned from 320 BC until his death in 315 BC.
King Shenjing was succeeded by his son, King Nan, who went on to have a very long reign.
Family
Sons:
* Prince Yan (; d. 256 BC), ruled as King Nan of Zhou from 314–256 BC

Family tree of ancient Chinese emperors
